A circular tube centre $O$ is filled with three fluids of densities $\rho_1, \rho_2, \rho_3$ (in descending order of magnitude) and placed in a vertical plane. If $2\alpha, 2\beta, 2\gamma$ be the angles subtended at the centres by the fluids and $P$ be the point on the circumference midway between the ends of the lightest fluid, then angle $\theta$ which $OP$ makes with the vertical is given by

$$\frac{\rho_2 - \rho_3}{\rho_1 - \rho_3} = \frac{\sin \alpha}{\sin (\alpha + \theta)} \frac{\sin (\beta - \theta)}{\sin \beta}$$

Let $O$ be the center and $r$ be the radius of the circular tube.

Let $AB, BC, CA$ contain the liquids of densities $\rho_1, \rho_2, \rho_3$. Then $\angle AOB = 2 \alpha, \angle BOC = 2 \beta, \angle COA = 2 \gamma$.

$P$ is the midpoint of arc $AC$. Then $\angle AOP = \angle COP = \gamma$.

Let $M$ be the lowest point of the circular tube. Let $MOD$ be the vertical. Then $\angle POD = \theta$.

$$\begin{align*} \mbox{Since } 2 \alpha + 2 \beta + 2 \gamma &= 2 \pi,\\ \alpha + \beta + \gamma &= \pi \\ \angle AOM &= \pi - \angle AOD = \pi - (\gamma + \theta) = \pi - \gamma - \theta = \alpha + \beta - \theta \\ \angle BOM &= \angle AOB - \angle AOM = 2 \alpha - (\alpha + \beta - \theta ) = \alpha - \beta + \theta\\ \angle COD &= \angle COP - \angle POD = \gamma - \theta = \pi - \beta - \alpha - \theta = \pi - (\alpha+ \beta+\theta)\\ \end{align*}$$

The pressures must be the same on the two sides of $M$.

\rho_1 OA' + \rho_3 r + \rho_3 OA' &= \rho_1 r - \rho_1 OB' + \rho_2 OC' + \rho_2 OB' + \rho_3 r - \rho_3 OC' \\ - \rho_1 OA' + \rho_3 OA' &= - \rho_1 OB' + \rho_2 OC' + \rho_2 OB' - \rho_3 OC' \\ %\rho_1 (OB' -
